turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Clyde Wynant's crazy... absolutely crazy to stay away at a time like this. No wonder the police think he has something to do with it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Oh, I know he didn't, but I wish I could find him...  I have something very important to tell him. Macaulay won't help at all.  He thinks I just want money.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Well, don't you?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: You're always teasing.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Nick, you will help me find Clyde -- won't you?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Now, Mimi, there are a thousand detectives in New York.  Hire one of them.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: But he knows you.  All you have to do is get in touch with him, and tell him that Mimi says everything is all right... but that I've got to see him.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I tell you again, I don't want any part of it.  Now you take Dorothy home and...

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Dorothy!  Is she here?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Where's Gilbert?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Gilbert!  Is he here too?  We might as well be living in the lobby.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Chris may be at the club -- or somewhere -- I don't see that it's important --

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You should have told them he'd disappeared.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: But he has nothing to do with it!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That's not for you to decide. Everybody's under suspicion - especially running off like this --  The police will want his description.  Is this a picture of him?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: I tell you -- he didn't do it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: They'll want more than your word for that.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: All right, then -- I'll tell them who did do it!

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: This is all very pleasant but why are here?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I've got some very important news - I've seen Wynant.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You did... where?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Last night.  He came to see me at my apartment.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh, did he?  What did he say?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: He didn't say very much.  Wanted to know how I was and how the children were.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Because I don't believe that Clyde's dead!  Why, you said yourself you saw him last night.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: So I did.  I saw him lying buried in his shop.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Perfectly absurd.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: And the murderer is right here in this room tonight... he's sitting at this table.  You may serve the fish.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Nobody told me.  I did see him!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What did he pay you, Mimi, to stick to that story?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: It isn't a story - it's true.  I did see Wynant.  He's not dead.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You're lying, Mimi.  But then, you'd do anything for money.  You're getting a good price for saying you saw Wynant and you figure you won't get anything if he's dead.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: I'm lot going to stay here to be insulted -

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Macaulay, you drew up Wynant's will.  Mimi was cut off, wasn't she, if she re-married?

turns.speaker: MORELLI
turns.text: I gotta talk to you.  I want you to tell me something and I want you to give it to me straight. Get me?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Do you mind putting that gun away? My wife doesn't care, but I'm in a delicate condition.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I've never heard about you.

turns.speaker: MORELLI
turns.text: I didn't knock Julia off.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: All right - you didn't.

turns.speaker: MORELLI
turns.text: I haven't seen her in three months. We were all washed up.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Why tell me?

turns.speaker: MORELLI
turns.text: I wouldn't have any reason to hurt her.  She was always on the up and up with me.  But that dirty little Nunheim -- he got sore cause I clicked with her and he didn't, so he put the finger on me.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That's all swell.  Only you're peddling your fish in the wrong market. I've got nothing to do with it.

turns.speaker: MORELLI
turns.text: Listen.  "Studsy" Burke told me you used to be O.K. That's why I'm here. Do  they....

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: How is Studsy?  I didn't know he was out of stir.

turns.speaker: MORELLI
turns.text: He's all right. He'd like to see you. But listen...  What's the law doing to me?  Do they think I did it, or is it just something else to pin on me?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'd tell you if I knew. But I'm not in this.  Ask the police.

turns.speaker: MORELLI
turns.text: That'd be very smart.  That'd be the smartest thing I ever did. Me that a police captain's been in a hospital three weeks on account we had an argument.  The boys would like to have me come in and ask questions.  They'd like it right down to the end of their blackjacks. Now I come to you on the level. Studsy says you're on the level. Be on the level.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I am on the level. If I knew anything I'd....

turns.speaker: MORELLI
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: This is your party.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Morelli -  You knew Julia.  Was she gypping Wynant?

turns.speaker: MORELLI
turns.text: She don't say she is, but I figure she is -

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Why do you say that?

turns.speaker: MORELLI
turns.text: Once I wanted five grand --  Cash -

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Thank you.  Now I'll tell you why I know Wynant didn't commit those murders -  Three months ago - the night that he caught you in Julia's apartment, he found out that Julia was cheating him, and was splitting with some man.  He went to find the man. That man was.... Tanner, don't you...?

turns.speaker: MORELLI
turns.text: What am I?  The fall guy?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I hope you won't let this news spoil your dinner.  Nice food, isn't it?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: So it's you he was after!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hello, baby.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: He's dragged me into every gin mill on the block.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I had him out this morning.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I thought so.  He even tried to drag me into the gentlemen's --

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh, this is Andy --

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: You might have mentioned me first.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: He's well-trained.  He'll behave himself.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: As long as there isn't a fire hydrant.  What I've gone through --

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Pretty girl.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: If you like 'em like that.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: You got types?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Only you, darling...  lanky brunettes with wicked jaws.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Who is she?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I was hoping I wouldn't have to tell you.  Dorothy is really my daughter.  You see, it was Spring in Venice, and I was so young.  I didn't know what I was doing.  We were all like that on my father's side.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: By the way, how is your father's side?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Much better, thanks.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: How many drinks have you had?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Six Martinis.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Six Martinis.  You're not going to have anything on me.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: What hit me?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That last Martini.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I can't lie here.  I've got to get up and trim that darned Christmas tree.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Take it easy.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Who's that?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Santa Claus.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Come on -- relax --  Give them a drink.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: We need ice.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I'd better order some food.  That sounds like an interesting case.  Wouldn't you like to take it?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I haven't the time.  I'm much too busy seeing that you don't lose any of the money I married you for.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Room service, please -

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Sounds like a good case.  Girl mysteriously murdered.  No one knows who did it.  They haven't found any clues yet -- no gun -- no fingerprints --

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I wonder if they've --  I don't want to hear anything about it.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Isn't that my drink?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What are you drinking?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Rye.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Where did you get that?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: She brought it in.  Trying to make me believe she did it.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: What are you going to do with it?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Nothing, 'til I find out if it's the gun Julia Wolf was killed with.  Keep her in here, and don't let those reporters see her. They might believe her.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: She didn't tell me a thing.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Too bad you didn't bring your whip.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Nick!  Nick!  Are you asleep?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Good. I want to talk to you.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That's jolly.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Don't you think you'd like to go back to detecting once in a while, just for the fun of it?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Can't you get to sleep?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Maybe a drink would help you.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Maybe it would if I took it.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Everybody says you were a grand detective.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: They were kidding you.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I'd like to see you work.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Tomorrow I'll buy you a whole lot of detective stories.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: That poor girl is in a tough spot.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: There's nothing I can do to help her.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: She thinks you can. It wouldn't hurt you to find out if you could, would it?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Darling, my guess is that Wynant killed Julia and Dorothy knows it. And the police'll catch him without my help.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I think I would like that drink.  I'll give you your Christmas present now if you'll give me mine.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: At breakfast.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: But it's Christmas now.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Breakfast.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: What are you going to give me?  I hope I don't like it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You'll have to keep them anyway. The man at the Aquarium said that he wouldn't take them back.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Nick!  Nick!  There's someone to she you,

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That's great.  I was afraid I'd have to go to sleep.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: You idiot!  Asta! Stop that!  Get down!  Now, stay there.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: All right... shoot!  I mean... what's on your mind?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It's all right.  It just grazed me.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Someone get a doctor.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: There's one coming.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Well, quick -- get into bed.  Are you all right?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Sure -- I don't even feel it.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I'll get some towels.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'll be all right. Don't let's fuss till the doctor comes.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Want a drink?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I wish that doctor'd come.  How do you feel?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: He'll be here.  Give him time to get his trousers on.  Where's Asta?  Asta!  Asta!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You're a fine watch dog.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: He's got more sense than you have. Thank Heaven you're not on this case.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: On it!  I'm in it ... They think I did it!

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Well, didn't you?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I never saw that before.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: No.  It's a Christmas present.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Who gave it to you?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: You did.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You must admit I have good taste.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Finished with these?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yes.  I know all they know about the murder. And I'm a great hero. The Tribune said I was shot twice.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I read you were shot five times in the tabloids.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That's not true.  He never came near my tabloids.  That's one thing I always protect... my tabloids.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hello... send him up.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Who's that?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Macaulay.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Aren't you hot in that?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I'm stifling, but it's so pretty.  The Kirbys.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Is that another Christmas present?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Did I give it to you?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Nick, listen.  From Clyde Wynant!  "Will you take charge of investigation on Julia Wolf murder. Communicate with Herbert Macaulay".

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Let's see.  Where's it from?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Philadelphia.  Then he didn't do it, did he, Nick?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: He wouldn't ask you to handle it if he were guilty.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Your guess is as good as mine.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Oh take it!  Please take it!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh, it's a fire hydrant.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Yes.  It's Asta's Christmas present.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Well, that's that.  Stay there, Nick!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It's not going to hurt me to get up.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Sit down!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You talk as if I were Asta.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: All right, hard guy.  Get up and bleed on the rugs.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: What's the trouble, Asta?  Your balloon busted?  So's mine.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: The mystery's all gone. And I wanted you to find out who did it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Maybe I will.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: But Wynant --- ?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I don't believe he did it.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Why don't you?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No reason.  Just a hunch.  But I'm going to find out.  I'm tired of being pushed around.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: So am I.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Come on, Watson, we're going places.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: This may be a little rough - you'd better let us go alone.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Catch me letting you go alone!

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I wish they'd stop that.  It makes me fidgety. Do you think they'll find him, Nick?  He must be in New York....  Where do you think you're going?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'm going to take Asta for a walk.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: He's just been for a walk.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: We're going sightseeing -- aren't we, Asta?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: What's that?  What are you up to?  Nickie - what is this?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Looks like a hold-up!

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I've got hunch.  I'm going down to look at Wynant's shop, I want to find out why it's closed.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Why shouldn't be close it? He went away.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: He went away lots of times when I knew him - but he never closed his shop. I've got a hunch something is up.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: You mean, he might be hiding there?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I don't know...  This thing has got my goat. I've got to find out.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Nick - I won't have you going down there.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Say you're the one who got me in this!

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I know but this is different. He's a crazy man. He might kill you.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'll be all right.  I've got Asta to protect me.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Go on - go on - see if I care. But it's a dirty trick bringing me all the way to New York just to make me a widow.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You wouldn't be a widow long.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: You bet I wouldn't.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Not with all your money!

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: You dog!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Goodbye, darling.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Nickie, take care of yourself won't you?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Sure I will.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Don't say it that way. Say it as if you meant it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Why, I believe the little woman cares.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I don't care - I'm just used to you, that's all --  If you let anything happen to him, you'll never wag that tail again!

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Back to California

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: My soul, woman.  I give you three murders and you aren't satisfied.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I want you to stay and find Wynant.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I did find him!

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: He was down in the shop.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Nick!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It was his body that was buried there.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Nick, you'd better lay off that liquor.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That's a fact.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Wynant's body?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yup.  Don't you want something to eat?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: But they all said it was Rosebreen's.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That's what they think... Guild and all of them.  They take it for granted that it's just another of Wynant's victims.  Guild's hot-footing it around now, looking for Wynant. That's all that troubles him.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: What makes you so sure it's Wynant's body?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Several things.  Hello, Fred.  We're hungry again. Yeah, and lots of onions.  Oh, and coffee.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Nick, you'll drive me crazy.  What things?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: What things made you so sure?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh.  Well, the clothes for instance. They were carefully preserved, and the body was just as carefully destroyed.  The person who killed him counted on one thing... that all skeletons look alike.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Well, don't they?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: You don't get another swallow 'til you really open up.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I remembered that Wynant had some shrapnel in his shin.  It often bothered him.  So I looked for it and I found it.  Gimme.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: How long has he been dead?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Couple of months anyway.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Then he couldn't have committed those other murders.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Smart gal.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Wynant dead?  Does Dorothy know?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No.  Nobody but you.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I'm going to tell her.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hey... hey.  Don't do that.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: But the poor kid's going crazy. She'd rather know her father was dead than that...

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I can't help it. I can't tell a soul.  I didn't even tell Guild.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I want to lie low till I get the whole dope.  I don't want to go off half-cocked.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'm going to get the real murderer. I've got an idea.  Want to see me take him?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Got a nice evening dress?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Now Nick, what's that got to do with it?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Got a nice evening dress?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I've got a lulu -- why?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'm going to give a party, and invite all of the suspects.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: The suspects!  They won't come.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh, they'll come.  I'll have Guild issue the invitations.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Who do you think did it?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Mimi...

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Mimi!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Mimi, Jorgensen, Morelli, Tanner.....

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: You give such charming parties, Mr. Charles.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Thank you, Mrs. Charles.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I can't wait any longer.  Tell me, do you think one of them did it?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I wish you'd tell me who.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I wish you'd tell me.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Serve the nuts - I mean, serve the guests the nuts.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'm afraid you're lying, Mimi. You see, I really did see Wynant last night.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: You're going to drive me crazy!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Let's see... where was I?  Oh, yes.  He went to find the man. That man was desperate!  He knew that he was caught dead to rights -- and with prison staring him in the face, he took the only way out. He killed Wynant.  It's terrible to tell you this way but your father's dead, Dorothy.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: If that knife is missing, I'll look for it in your back.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: After our hero had killed Wynant, he got a brilliant idea.  He realized that he and Julia could still collect money.  Wynant was supposed to be on a trip - no one knew where - so our dinner guest wrote letters to Macaulay, signing Wynant's name, so that Macaulay would continue to send the money to Julia.  He even telephoned Macaulay --  Do you remember?.... the first day that you came to see me... he telephoned that he was in town?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Is that true?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Why are you saying it?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It's the only way it makes sense.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I hope you're well.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: His plan was still working beautifully. Wynant was established as being in town.  The watch chain was handed over....  ...with a slight delay...to the police. The only hitch was a man named Nunheim who had found out something.  Our hero paid Nunheim once to keep his mouth shut, and when Nunheim threatened him again, he bumped him off.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Come on out, now.  He won't hurt you.  Back to your old tricks, eh, Tanner?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: No, Mr. Charles.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: How did you get in here?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: I had a key. I worked here... till they closed the shop.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You worked here?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Yes, sir.  Julia Wolf got me a job as bookkeeper.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Well, that's a hot one.  You a bookkeeper!  When were you ever a bookkeeper?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: That time you sent me up last ... I learned book-keeping at Sing Sing.  I figured it might be an in for me somewhere's.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Somewhere's where they might go out and leave the safe open?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Honest, Mr, Charles.  I never touched that safe.  Them bonds that were missing... Julia took them.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Trying to put it off on her?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Mr. Charles - she did - that's why he got sore at her and killed her. Listen, Mr. Charles --  I did do a little chiseling.  I come to bring it back and fix up the books.  I didn't want him to find out and come after me -

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You can save that and tell it to the police.  They'll be here in a minute.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Police!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'm sorry.  Tanner, don't you want some wine?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: No... no.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: That's what Mr. Wynant said to me. If she re-married, all the money was to go to the children.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You shouldn't let that keep you from telling truth, Mimi.  Mrs. Jorgensen -  Were you ever divorced from Chris Jorgensen?

turns.speaker: PEPPLER
turns.text: Nick Charles here?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Yes.  Nick!

turns.speaker: PEPPLER
turns.text: You his wife?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PEPPLER
turns.text: He's a good guy.  He sent me up the river once.  Hey, Nick!

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Was he a good detective?

turns.speaker: PEPPLER
turns.text: I wouldn't know.  That time he caught me was a accident.  I led with my right.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Well, congratulations.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: I'm going to give her a wedding present.  Thought I'd better do it now, before I forget it.  I can drop them on my way to...  That's funny....  Where are those bonds?

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Bonds, sir?

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: I know I left them there.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: Maybe Miss Wolf has them.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Maybe she has.

turns.speaker: TANNER
turns.text: You're forgetting the check for your suitcase.  It's at the Grand Central.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Oh, yes -- yes -- that's right --

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'm sorry...  but...

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Two weeks work gone for nothing.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I just wanted to tell you...

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: I don't care what you wanted to tell me.  You're through!  Get your things and get out!

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Home!

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Home?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'm fired.

turns.speaker: WYNANT
turns.text: Who fired you?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You did.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You speak English?  DO YOU SPEAK ENGLISH!?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Y-yes.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Where were you going?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Baghdad.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What's in the other direction?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: This road, it leads straight to Kuwait.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Turn the car around.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Please, I beg of you.  The American army is there.  I am Iraqi.  They will kill me.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Nobody's going to hurt you.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Think we're going to do it?  Think we're going to war?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Not up to us.  Up to the Iraqis.  All they have to do is get out of Kuwait.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: ...And it's very important when you sit down never to point the soles of your shoes at anyone.  It's considered offensive.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You know so much about the Middle East, you know where we can get something to eat.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Like learning Arabic?  You're gonna learn Arabic you might as well learn were we can get something to eat around here.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I didn't learn Arabic because we were getting shipped here.  You don't learn it in a couple of weeks.  I studied it in high school.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Well, based on my knowledge of the region, its culture and her people I would have to say it's a box.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Can you eat it?  If you can't eat it I really don't care what it is.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Paper.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's a fortune box.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What's it say?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Help, I'm being held prisoner in a puzzle box factory.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: It's a map, I think that's what it is.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: There you go, Jaeger.  Just find the buried treasure, and you're a millionaire.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: A casual one.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Damn, this is sweet.  We are going to be home in no time.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Better grab up some sand to take home to your family.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You're out of your minds, you know that? Both of you.  You don't even know if there's anything out there.  What the hell are you thinking?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I'm thinking about when this war is over. Why you figure I'm here?  'Cause I got tired of being president of GM?  If a brother doesn't play ball, or deal drugs there aren't too many big money prospects around, and I'm not particularly interested in spending the rest of my life fighting the oil companies' wars. So I say if maybe there's something out there, what the hell, that's what I say.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Yeah!  Welcome to beautiful Iraq.  Land of enchantment and riches.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Oh, God.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I know you think this is crazy, but a couple of hours from now you're going to be one rich dude trying to buy up every other puzzle box out there.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I'd settle for being alive.  Really. Alive would be fine.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Why, yes, Jaeger.  I believe it is.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: No, please, not again.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What are we going to do!?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We're going to keep driving.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: They stopped.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Wha...

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Oh, Jesus, they've stopped.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: They shouldn't have been here.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: We shouldn't have been here, Epps.  There is a war going on!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: This is miles from the battle lines. They were probably deserters.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Deserters would have run, they wouldn't have engaged.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: They shouldn't have been out this way, that's all I'm saying.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What are you doing.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Low on gas.  Got to refill.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You two fighting's not going to get us anything.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Him getting us stranded out here doesn't do much good either.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Maybe we are crazy for doing this.  But if we do it, we do it right.  I just needed to explain that in a way I wouldn't have to do it again.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Not much chance of that.  Jaeger's an idiot.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: He's not so--

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: He's an idiot, and he's not nearly as hard as he thinks.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: How tough you have to be to make the army?  All you've got to do is shoot a gun, and stop a bullet.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What kind of mine?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I don't know, and I wasn't about to mess with it.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Should have blown already.  Delayed fuse, that's Vietnam stuff.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Maybe that's all the Iraqis could afford, okay?  Maybe they got it on discount. Maybe the fuse is messed up.  Or maybe it's going to go off in two seconds, and we won't have to worry about getting Jaeger down off there, all we'll have to worry about is finding the pieces.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We've got rope?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: For climbing.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Break it out.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What if it's a Valloro 69?  Just going to bounce right up out of the ground, explode in the air, kill him and us.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You just go when I say go.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Should have at least gotten the map off of him.  Blows up with him then we did all this for nothing.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: All right.  Let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: The soldiers are going to kill those people!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: There's nothing we can do.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: We can fight.  That's what we're here for:  To fight the Iraqis.  To help the Shi'ites, and the Khurds.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I don't want to see people killed any more than you.  But we try to help out we die, and all we do is die.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: We can't just go off and--

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: There's nothing we can do.  We shouldn't even be here in the first place.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: All we've got to do is make it to the top.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: And find the treasure, and get it, and get back to the Humvee, and get the hell out of Iraqi without getting our heads blown off, but that's about it.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We're not going to find anything standing here.  Let's get to climbing.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Not much of a pass.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Probably was a couple of hundred years ago when whoever drew the map came through here.  Worn down to nothing now.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Picks up again just on the other side.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: The US Army:  Always an adventure.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Let me see the map.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Should be easy going from here.  Stay on the pass straight to the dot.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What do you figure it to be?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Got to be some kind of landmark; something distinctive.
